trans-unit.source: How to use Service Bus topics (Node.js) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Service Bus topics (Node.js) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure from a Node.js app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure from a Node.js app.

trans-unit.source: How to Use Service Bus topics and subscriptions
trans-unit.target: How to Use Service Bus topics and subscriptions

trans-unit.source: This guide describes how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions
trans-unit.target: This guide describes how to use Service Bus topics and subscriptions

trans-unit.source: from Node.js applications.
trans-unit.target: from Node.js applications.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include **creating topics and subscriptions, creating subscription filters, sending messages** to a topic, **receiving messages from a subscription**, and
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include **creating topics and subscriptions, creating subscription filters, sending messages** to a topic, **receiving messages from a subscription**, and

trans-unit.source: **deleting topics and subscriptions**.
trans-unit.target: **deleting topics and subscriptions**.

trans-unit.source: For more information on topics
trans-unit.target: For more information on topics

trans-unit.source: and subscriptions, see the [Next steps](#next-steps) section.
trans-unit.target: and subscriptions, see the [Next steps](#next-steps) section.

trans-unit.source: Configure your application to use Service Bus
trans-unit.target: Configure your application to use Service Bus

trans-unit.source: To use Service Bus, download the Node.js azure package.
trans-unit.target: To use Service Bus, download the Node.js azure package.

trans-unit.source: This package includes a set of libraries that
trans-unit.target: This package includes a set of libraries that

trans-unit.source: communicate with the Service Bus REST services.
trans-unit.target: communicate with the Service Bus REST services.

trans-unit.source: Use Node Package Manager (NPM) to obtain the package
trans-unit.target: Use Node Package Manager (NPM) to obtain the package

trans-unit.source: Use a command-line interface such as **PowerShell** (Windows,) **Terminal** (Mac,) or **Bash** (Unix), navigate to the folder where you created your sample application.
trans-unit.target: Use a command-line interface such as **PowerShell** (Windows,) **Terminal** (Mac,) or **Bash** (Unix), navigate to the folder where you created your sample application.

trans-unit.target: Inside that folder find the

trans-unit.source: Set up a Service Bus connection
trans-unit.target: Set up a Service Bus connection

trans-unit.source: The azure module will read the environment variables AZURE\_SERVICEBUS\_NAMESPACE and AZURE\_SERVICEBUS\_ACCESS\_KEY for information required to connect to your Azure Service Bus.
trans-unit.target: The azure module will read the environment variables AZURE\_SERVICEBUS\_NAMESPACE and AZURE\_SERVICEBUS\_ACCESS\_KEY for information required to connect to your Azure Service Bus.

trans-unit.source: If these environment variables are not set, you must specify the account information when calling **createServiceBusService**.
trans-unit.target: If these environment variables are not set, you must specify the account information when calling **createServiceBusService**.

trans-unit.source: For an example of setting the environment variables in a configuration file for an Azure Cloud Service, see [Node.js Cloud Service with Storage].
trans-unit.target: For an example of setting the environment variables in a configuration file for an Azure Cloud Service, see [Node.js Cloud Service with Storage].

trans-unit.source: For an example of setting the environment variables in the management portal for an Azure Website, see [Node.js Web Application with Storage]
trans-unit.target: For an example of setting the environment variables in the management portal for an Azure Website, see [Node.js Web Application with Storage]

trans-unit.source: Filters
trans-unit.target: Filters

trans-unit.source: Optional filtering operations can be applied to operations performed using **ServiceBusService**.
trans-unit.target: Optional filtering operations can be applied to operations performed using **ServiceBusService**.

trans-unit.source: Filtering operations can include logging, automatically retrying, etc. Filters are objects that implement a method with the signature:
trans-unit.target: Filtering operations can include logging, automatically retrying, etc. Filters are objects that implement a method with the signature:

trans-unit.source: After doing its preprocessing on the request options, the method needs to call "next" passing a callback with the following signature:
trans-unit.target: After doing its preprocessing on the request options, the method needs to call "next" passing a callback with the following signature:

trans-unit.source: In this callback, and after processing the returnObject (the response from the request to the server), the callback needs to either invoke next if it exists to continue processing other filters or simply invoke finalCallback otherwise to end up the service invocation.
trans-unit.target: In this callback, and after processing the returnObject (the response from the request to the server), the callback needs to either invoke next if it exists to continue processing other filters or simply invoke finalCallback otherwise to end up the service invocation.

trans-unit.source: Two filters that implement retry logic are included with the Azure SDK for Node.js, **ExponentialRetryPolicyFilter** and **LinearRetryPolicyFilter**.
trans-unit.target: Two filters that implement retry logic are included with the Azure SDK for Node.js, **ExponentialRetryPolicyFilter** and **LinearRetryPolicyFilter**.

trans-unit.source: The following creates a **ServiceBusService** object that uses the **ExponentialRetryPolicyFilter**:
trans-unit.target: The following creates a **ServiceBusService** object that uses the **ExponentialRetryPolicyFilter**:

trans-unit.source: How to create subscriptions
trans-unit.target: How to create subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Topic subscriptions are also created with the **ServiceBusService**
trans-unit.target: Topic subscriptions are also created with the **ServiceBusService**

trans-unit.source: object.
trans-unit.target: object.

trans-unit.source: Subscriptions are named and can have an optional filter that
trans-unit.target: Subscriptions are named and can have an optional filter that

trans-unit.source: restricts the set of messages delivered to the subscription's virtual
trans-unit.target: restricts the set of messages delivered to the subscription's virtual

trans-unit.source: queue.
trans-unit.target: queue.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Subscriptions are persistent and will continue to exist until
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Subscriptions are persistent and will continue to exist until

trans-unit.source: either they, or the topic they are associated with, are deleted.
trans-unit.target: either they, or the topic they are associated with, are deleted.

trans-unit.source: If your
trans-unit.target: If your

trans-unit.source: application contains logic to create a subscription, it should first
trans-unit.target: application contains logic to create a subscription, it should first

trans-unit.source: check if the subscription already exists by using the
trans-unit.target: check if the subscription already exists by using the

trans-unit.source: **getSubscription** method.
trans-unit.target: **getSubscription** method.

trans-unit.source: Create a subscription with the default (MatchAll) filter
trans-unit.target: Create a subscription with the default (MatchAll) filter

trans-unit.source: The **MatchAll** filter is the default filter that is used if no filter
trans-unit.target: The **MatchAll** filter is the default filter that is used if no filter

trans-unit.source: is specified when a new subscription is created.
trans-unit.target: is specified when a new subscription is created.

trans-unit.source: When the **MatchAll**
trans-unit.target: When the **MatchAll**

trans-unit.source: filter is used, all messages published to the topic are placed in the
trans-unit.target: filter is used, all messages published to the topic are placed in the

trans-unit.source: subscription's virtual queue.
trans-unit.target: subscription's virtual queue.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a

trans-unit.source: subscription named 'AllMessages' and uses the default **MatchAll**
trans-unit.target: subscription named 'AllMessages' and uses the default **MatchAll**

trans-unit.source: filter.
trans-unit.target: filter.

trans-unit.source: Create subscriptions with filters
trans-unit.target: Create subscriptions with filters

trans-unit.source: You can also create filters that allow you to scope which messages sent
trans-unit.target: You can also create filters that allow you to scope which messages sent

trans-unit.source: to a topic should show up within a specific topic subscription.
trans-unit.target: to a topic should show up within a specific topic subscription.

trans-unit.source: The most flexible type of filter supported by subscriptions is the
trans-unit.target: The most flexible type of filter supported by subscriptions is the

trans-unit.source: **SqlFilter**, which implements a subset of SQL92.
trans-unit.target: **SqlFilter**, which implements a subset of SQL92.

trans-unit.source: SQL filters operate
trans-unit.target: SQL filters operate

trans-unit.source: on the properties of the messages that are published to the topic.
trans-unit.target: on the properties of the messages that are published to the topic.

trans-unit.source: For
trans-unit.target: For

trans-unit.source: more details about the expressions that can be used with a SQL filter,
trans-unit.target: more details about the expressions that can be used with a SQL filter,

trans-unit.source: review the [SqlFilter.SqlExpression][SqlFilter.SqlExpression] syntax.
trans-unit.target: review the [SqlFilter.SqlExpression][SqlFilter.SqlExpression] syntax.

trans-unit.target: Filters can be added to a subscription by using the **createRule**

trans-unit.source: method of the **ServiceBusService** object.
trans-unit.target: method of the **ServiceBusService** object.

trans-unit.source: This method allows you to
trans-unit.target: This method allows you to

trans-unit.source: add new filters to an existing subscription.
trans-unit.target: add new filters to an existing subscription.

trans-unit.target: Since the default filter is applied automatically to all new

trans-unit.target: subscriptions, you must first remove the default filter or the

trans-unit.target: **MatchAll** will override any other filters you may specify.

trans-unit.target: You can

trans-unit.target: remove the default rule by using the **deleteRule** method of the

trans-unit.source: **ServiceBusService** object.
trans-unit.target: **ServiceBusService** object.

trans-unit.target: The example below creates a subscription named 'HighMessages' with a

trans-unit.target: **SqlFilter** that only selects messages that have a custom

trans-unit.target: **messagenumber** property greater than 3:

trans-unit.source: How to send messages to a topic
trans-unit.target: How to send messages to a topic

trans-unit.source: To send a message to a Service Bus topic, your application must use the
trans-unit.target: To send a message to a Service Bus topic, your application must use the

trans-unit.source: **sendTopicMessage** method of the **ServiceBusService** object.
trans-unit.target: **sendTopicMessage** method of the **ServiceBusService** object.

trans-unit.source: Messages sent to Service Bus Topics are **BrokeredMessage** objects.
trans-unit.target: Messages sent to Service Bus Topics are **BrokeredMessage** objects.

trans-unit.source: **BrokeredMessage** objects have a set of standard properties (such as
trans-unit.target: **BrokeredMessage** objects have a set of standard properties (such as

trans-unit.source: **Label** and **TimeToLive**), a dictionary that is used to hold custom
trans-unit.target: **Label** and **TimeToLive**), a dictionary that is used to hold custom

trans-unit.source: application specific properties, and a body of string data.
trans-unit.target: application specific properties, and a body of string data.

trans-unit.source: An
trans-unit.target: An

trans-unit.source: application can set the body of the message by passing a string value to
trans-unit.target: application can set the body of the message by passing a string value to

trans-unit.source: the **sendTopicMessage** and any required standard properties will be
trans-unit.target: the **sendTopicMessage** and any required standard properties will be

trans-unit.source: populated by default values.
trans-unit.target: populated by default values.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates how to send five test messages to
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates how to send five test messages to

trans-unit.source: 'MyTopic'.
trans-unit.target: 'MyTopic'.

trans-unit.source: Note that the **messagenumber** property value of each
trans-unit.target: Note that the **messagenumber** property value of each

trans-unit.source: message varies on the iteration of the loop (this will determine which
trans-unit.target: message varies on the iteration of the loop (this will determine which

trans-unit.source: subscriptions receive it):
trans-unit.target: subscriptions receive it):

trans-unit.source: Service Bus topics support a maximum message size of 256 MB (the header,
trans-unit.target: Service Bus topics support a maximum message size of 256 MB (the header,

trans-unit.source: which includes the standard and custom application properties, can have
trans-unit.target: which includes the standard and custom application properties, can have

trans-unit.source: a maximum size of 64 MB).
trans-unit.target: a maximum size of 64 MB).

trans-unit.source: There is no limit on the number of messages
trans-unit.target: There is no limit on the number of messages

trans-unit.source: held in a topic but there is a cap on the total size of the messages
trans-unit.target: held in a topic but there is a cap on the total size of the messages

trans-unit.source: held by a topic.
trans-unit.target: held by a topic.

trans-unit.source: This topic size is defined at creation time, with an
trans-unit.target: This topic size is defined at creation time, with an

trans-unit.source: upper limit of 5 GB.
trans-unit.target: upper limit of 5 GB.

trans-unit.source: How to receive messages from a subscription
trans-unit.target: How to receive messages from a subscription

trans-unit.source: Messages are received from a subscription using the
trans-unit.target: Messages are received from a subscription using the

trans-unit.source: **receiveSubscriptionMessage** method on the **ServiceBusService**
trans-unit.target: **receiveSubscriptionMessage** method on the **ServiceBusService**

trans-unit.source: object.
trans-unit.target: object.

trans-unit.source: By default, messages are deleted from the subscription as they
trans-unit.target: By default, messages are deleted from the subscription as they

trans-unit.source: are read; however, you can read (peek) and lock the message without
trans-unit.target: are read; however, you can read (peek) and lock the message without

trans-unit.source: deleting it from the subscription by setting the optional parameter
trans-unit.target: deleting it from the subscription by setting the optional parameter

trans-unit.source: **isPeekLock** to **true**.
trans-unit.target: **isPeekLock** to **true**.

trans-unit.source: The default behavior of reading and deleting the message as part of the
trans-unit.target: The default behavior of reading and deleting the message as part of the

trans-unit.source: receive operation is the simplest model, and works best for scenarios in
trans-unit.target: receive operation is the simplest model, and works best for scenarios in

trans-unit.source: which an application can tolerate not processing a message in the event
trans-unit.target: which an application can tolerate not processing a message in the event

trans-unit.source: of a failure.
trans-unit.target: of a failure.

trans-unit.source: To understand this, consider a scenario in which the
trans-unit.target: To understand this, consider a scenario in which the

trans-unit.source: consumer issues the receive request and then crashes before processing
trans-unit.target: consumer issues the receive request and then crashes before processing

trans-unit.source: it.
trans-unit.target: it.

trans-unit.source: Because Service Bus will have marked the message as being consumed,
trans-unit.target: Because Service Bus will have marked the message as being consumed,

trans-unit.source: then when the application restarts and begins consuming messages again,
trans-unit.target: then when the application restarts and begins consuming messages again,

trans-unit.source: it will have missed the message that was consumed prior to the crash.
trans-unit.target: it will have missed the message that was consumed prior to the crash.

trans-unit.source: If the **isPeekLock** parameter is set to **true**, the receive becomes
trans-unit.target: If the **isPeekLock** parameter is set to **true**, the receive becomes

trans-unit.source: a two stage operation, which makes it possible to support applications
trans-unit.target: a two stage operation, which makes it possible to support applications

trans-unit.source: that cannot tolerate missing messages.
trans-unit.target: that cannot tolerate missing messages.

trans-unit.source: When Service Bus receives a
trans-unit.target: When Service Bus receives a

trans-unit.source: request, it finds the next message to be consumed, locks it to prevent
trans-unit.target: request, it finds the next message to be consumed, locks it to prevent

trans-unit.source: other consumers receiving it, and then returns it to the application.
trans-unit.target: other consumers receiving it, and then returns it to the application.

trans-unit.source: After the application finishes processing the message (or stores it
trans-unit.target: After the application finishes processing the message (or stores it

trans-unit.source: reliably for future processing), it completes the second stage of the
trans-unit.target: reliably for future processing), it completes the second stage of the

trans-unit.source: receive process by calling **deleteMessage** method and providing the
trans-unit.target: receive process by calling **deleteMessage** method and providing the

trans-unit.source: message to be deleted as a parameter.
trans-unit.target: message to be deleted as a parameter.

trans-unit.source: The **deleteMessage** method will
trans-unit.target: The **deleteMessage** method will

trans-unit.source: mark the message as being consumed and remove it from the subscription.
trans-unit.target: mark the message as being consumed and remove it from the subscription.

trans-unit.target: The example below demonstrates how messages can be received and

trans-unit.source: processed using **receiveSubscriptionMessage**.
trans-unit.target: processed using **receiveSubscriptionMessage**.

trans-unit.source: How to handle application crashes and unreadable messages
trans-unit.target: How to handle application crashes and unreadable messages

trans-unit.source: Service Bus provides functionality to help you gracefully recover from
trans-unit.target: Service Bus provides functionality to help you gracefully recover from

trans-unit.source: errors in your application or difficulties processing a message.
trans-unit.target: errors in your application or difficulties processing a message.

trans-unit.source: If a
trans-unit.target: If a

trans-unit.source: receiver application is unable to process the message for some reason,
trans-unit.target: receiver application is unable to process the message for some reason,

trans-unit.source: then it can call the **unlockMessage** method on the
trans-unit.target: then it can call the **unlockMessage** method on the

trans-unit.source: **ServiceBusService** object.
trans-unit.target: **ServiceBusService** object.

trans-unit.source: This will cause Service Bus to unlock the
trans-unit.target: This will cause Service Bus to unlock the

trans-unit.source: message within the subscription and make it available to be received
trans-unit.target: message within the subscription and make it available to be received

trans-unit.source: again, either by the same consuming application or by another consuming
trans-unit.target: again, either by the same consuming application or by another consuming

trans-unit.source: application.
trans-unit.target: application.

trans-unit.source: There is also a timeout associated with a message locked within the
trans-unit.target: There is also a timeout associated with a message locked within the

trans-unit.source: subscription, and if the application fails to process the message before
trans-unit.target: subscription, and if the application fails to process the message before

trans-unit.source: the lock timeout expires (e.g., if the application crashes), then
trans-unit.target: the lock timeout expires (e.g., if the application crashes), then

trans-unit.source: Service Bus will unlock the message automatically and make it available
trans-unit.target: Service Bus will unlock the message automatically and make it available

trans-unit.source: to be received again.
trans-unit.target: to be received again.

trans-unit.source: In the event that the application crashes after processing the message
trans-unit.target: In the event that the application crashes after processing the message

trans-unit.source: but before the **deleteMessage** method is called, then the message will
trans-unit.target: but before the **deleteMessage** method is called, then the message will

trans-unit.source: be redelivered to the application when it restarts.
trans-unit.target: be redelivered to the application when it restarts.

trans-unit.source: This is often called
trans-unit.target: This is often called

trans-unit.source: **At Least Once Processing**, that is, each message will be processed at
trans-unit.target: **At Least Once Processing**, that is, each message will be processed at

trans-unit.source: least once but in certain situations the same message may be
trans-unit.target: least once but in certain situations the same message may be

trans-unit.source: redelivered.
trans-unit.target: redelivered.

trans-unit.source: If the scenario cannot tolerate duplicate processing, then
trans-unit.target: If the scenario cannot tolerate duplicate processing, then

trans-unit.source: application developers should add additional logic to their application
trans-unit.target: application developers should add additional logic to their application

trans-unit.source: to handle duplicate message delivery.
trans-unit.target: to handle duplicate message delivery.

trans-unit.source: This is often achieved using the
trans-unit.target: This is often achieved using the

trans-unit.source: **MessageId** property of the message, which will remain constant across
trans-unit.target: **MessageId** property of the message, which will remain constant across

trans-unit.source: delivery attempts.
trans-unit.target: delivery attempts.

trans-unit.source: How to delete topics and subscriptions
trans-unit.target: How to delete topics and subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Topics and subscriptions are persistent, and must be explicitly deleted
trans-unit.target: Topics and subscriptions are persistent, and must be explicitly deleted

trans-unit.source: either through the Azure Management portal or programmatically.
trans-unit.target: either through the Azure Management portal or programmatically.

trans-unit.source: The example below demonstrates how to delete the topic named 'MyTopic':
trans-unit.target: The example below demonstrates how to delete the topic named 'MyTopic':

trans-unit.source: Deleting a topic will also delete any subscriptions that are registered
trans-unit.target: Deleting a topic will also delete any subscriptions that are registered

trans-unit.source: with the topic.
trans-unit.target: with the topic.

trans-unit.source: Subscriptions can also be deleted independently.
trans-unit.target: Subscriptions can also be deleted independently.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: following code demonstrates how to delete a subscription named
trans-unit.target: following code demonstrates how to delete a subscription named

trans-unit.source: 'HighMessages' from the 'MyTopic' topic:
trans-unit.target: 'HighMessages' from the 'MyTopic' topic:
